data.title: Stray Dogs (2020)
data.meta_description: After a man's beloved dog passes, he embarks on a backpacking trip with his brother to bury his dog where he found him. Along the way they encounter a stranger on the run who turns their world upside down. The brothers must unite in order to survive and finish the mission.
data.text:
Incredible that this still dragged so much clocking in at only 1:24 min. And with so much slo mo padding! but I overall enjoyed some of the overly dramatic camerawork! Don't get my rating wrong some of this i really enjoyed in that it made me say, "what!?" out loud a lot. I was intruiged by its premise and have a soft spot for low budget indie thriller/horror things, so even when the very beginning was a prolonged dog euthanasia scene I was like ok let's see where this goes. But unfortunately i never got the sense that there was a driving connection behind this story that would have compelled someone to make this, everyone was too thin of a…

I like the backstory of Jeff's dog - however the general plot seems like one which many films have employed.

The presentation is very good - however it descended into over-the-top melodrama in the final act (the discovery, inevitable 'chase,' and the finale).

The acting seems very good throughout.

The background music reminds me of "Twin Peaks" - soothing, yet underlying dread. I did notice that odd 'clicking' sound as Jeff hid behind the log - which seemed totally out-of-place.

The cinematography seems outstanding - with one minor 'complaint' - quite a few shots 'through' branches, etc., which I feel distracts at times. I noticed some slight jerkiness at the 51:00 mark (the flames), but that might have been due…
